contentrichtext.text: {{Other uses|Bondi (disambiguation)}} {{Infobox French commune |name = Bondy |image coat of arms = Blason_bondy.svg |image = Bondy Zone commerciale.jpg |map = Bondy_map.svg |map caption = [[Paris]] and inner ring départements |latitude = 48.9022 |longitude = 2.4828 |region = Île-de-France |department = Seine-Saint-Denis |arrondissement = Bobigny |canton = |INSEE = 93010 |postal code = 93140 |mayor = |term = |intercommunality = |elevation m = |elevation min m = |elevation max m = |area km2 = 5.47 |population = 53503 |population date = 2006 }} '''Bondy''' ({{IPA-fr|bɔ̃.di}}) is a [[Communes of France|commune]] in the northeastern suburbs of [[Paris]], [[France]]. It is located {{convert|10.9|km|mi|abbr=on}} from the [[Kilometre Zero|centre]] of [[Paris]]. ==Name== The name Bondy was recorded for the first time around AD 600 as ''Bonitiacum'', meaning "estate of Bonitius", a [[Gallo-Roman]] landowner. ==History== During the [[Middle Ages]] Bondy was primarily forest. The forest of Bondy was a well-known haunt of bandits and robbers and was extremely dangerous. On 3 January 1905, a third of the territory of Bondy was detached and became the commune of [[Les Pavillons-sous-Bois]]. On 30 October 2007, a gas explosion killed one person and injured 47 people. Bondy and its integration into Paris is the subject of part of the second-last chapter of [[Graham Robb]]'s book ''[[Parisians]]''. ==Personalities== * [[Frederic Bakekolo]], handball player * [[Serge Gakpe]] footballer * [[Max Hilaire]] footballer * [[Muriel Hurtis]], [[track and field]] athlete * [[Steven Joseph-Monrose]] footballer * [[Kevin Lafrance]] footballer * [[David Larose]], judoka * [[André Malraux]] spent much of his childhood in Bondy. * [[Sylvain Meslien]] footballer * [[Guy Moussi]], midfielder for English football team [[Nottingham Forest|Nottingham Forest F.C.]] * [[Michael Nicoise]] footballer * [[Maureen Nisima]] fencer * Birthplace of [[Claude-Carloman de Rulhière]] (1735–1791), poet and historian. * [[Lalya Sidibe]] basketball player * [[Doriane Tahane]] basketball player * [[Audrey Tcheumeo]] judoka * [[Teddy Tinmar]] athlete * [[Bakaye Traoré]] footballer * [[Fodie Traore]] footballer * [[Jimmy Vicaut]] athlete * [[Thierry Zig]],basketball player ==Demographics== ===Immigration=== {{France immigration |collectivity_name=Bondy |census_year=1999 |metropolitan_France=72.2 |outside_metropolitan_France=27.8 |overseas_France=3.6 |foreign_French=2.7 |EU-15=3.4 |non-EU-15=18.1 }} ==Administration== Bondy is divided into two [[canton in France|cantons]]: *The [[canton of Bondy-Nord-Ouest]] (North-West) account 24,953 inhabitants (53.3%); *The [[canton of Bondy-Sud-Est]] (South-East) account 21,873 inhabitants (46.7%). ==Transport== Bondy is served by [[Bondy (Paris RER)|Bondy]] station on Paris [[RER E|RER line E]]. ==See also== *[[Communes of the Seine-Saint-Denis department]] ==References== *[http://www.insee.fr/en/home/home_page.asp INSEE] {{reflist}} ==External links== {{Commons category|Bondy}} * [http://www.ville-bondy.fr/ Town council website] (in French) {{Paris Metropolitan Area}} {{Seine-Saint-Denis communes}} [[Category:Communes of Seine-Saint-Denis]] {{SeineSaintDenis-geo-stub}} [[sr:Бонди]]
